intro: Heliophila canescens, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Heliophila canescens is often found in moist, calcareous soils and is commonly used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
